result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcos D. Carlin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Huber Notice

[MA]Cases 15CF227, 16CT260, & 17CF5 called together at 11:18am
Defendant Marcos D. Carlin in court, in custody with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer.  Susan Victoria Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
No factual corrections to DOC packet in Case 15CF227

As to Cases 16CT260 & 17CF5:
  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #1 of Case 17CF5 & Case 16CT260; factual basis given; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court dismisses outright: Count #2 of Case 17CF5

Sentencing arguments given by DA Happ; Atty. Fischer 
Off record from approximately: 11:30-11:40am due to power outage

As to Case 15CF227, Count #3: The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 7 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence forthwith
--189 days credit for time already served given

As to Case 15CF227, Count #4: The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 6 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to be served consecutive to the sentence in Count #3 of Case 15CF227

As to Case 17CF5, Count #1: The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 10 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to be served concurrent to the sentence in 15CF227
--187 days credit for time already served given
--to pay statutory costs plus $100 witness/officer overtime
The Court orders the Defendant to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office today for DNA sample provision.

As to Case 16CT260: The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 5  days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to be served consecutive to the sentence in 15CF227
--0 days credit for time already served given
--to pay statutory costs
The Court orders the Defendant to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office today for DNA sample provision.

The Court orders outstanding costs of case 15CF227 and statutory costs/fees of cases 17CF5 & 16CT260 are to be paid in $35 per month installments commencing on 9/30/17 and on the last day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a  15 day jail term per count, with Huber privileges, consecutive


recess: 12:00pm

Case called at 1:44 pm [SH] (Case was scheduled for FSSC)
Defendant Marcos D. Carlin in court with Attorney Steven J. Luchsinger. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock files AMENDED complaint; Service of AMENDED complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #3 & #4; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #1 & #2

On Counts #3 & #4, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--To undergo any type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program, per Agent
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay $124 subpoena fees
--No contact with victim, initials, A.N.P.
--Reimburse Attorney fees
APPLY CASH BOND-return remainder to surety if any

Days credit for time already served: 2 days
Court presents basis and denies expungement
Recess: 2:04 pm
State's with Cover Letter

Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

case called at 1:19-pm [mo] 
Defendant Marcos D. Carlin appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert (for bond purposes only).  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Atty. Dahnert indicates that Mr. Carlin is not eligible for PD representation at this time

The Court gives right to counsel

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 


Bond arguments given by Counsel
The Court requires a $1,250 cash bond, with conditions:
--No contact with victim, A.N.P.
--No presence at 709 S. 6th St., Watertown, WI
--no acts or threats of violence

Preliminary Hearing time limits apply (10 days)

recess 1:26  pm.
